intro: Helinus brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed helinus, is a flowering plant native to the Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, hairy fruits. Helinus brevipes is often found in coastal and mountainous areas, where it thrives in full sun and dry conditions.
